item.title: [TRU] Interim order maintained in TruCap Finance's open offer case by Securities Appellate Tribunal
item.description:
Sundae Capital Advisors Pvt Ltd, the Manager to the Offer, has informed BSE about the interim order of the Hon'ble Securities Appellate Tribunal in the matter of the open offer given by Marwadi Chandarana Intermediaries Brokers Private Limited to the shareholders of Trucap Finance Limited. The Tribunal had previously passed an interim order to maintain status quo till the next hearing, and in the hearing held on February 20, 2026, it allowed the respondent a time of two weeks to file a reply. The interim order continues till the next date of listing, which is March 25, 2026. The appeal is listed for the next hearing on the same date.

  • Interim order maintained in TruCap Finance's open offer case by Securities Appellate Tribunal
  • Respondent allowed two weeks to file reply, rejoinder to be filed within two weeks thereafter
  • Interim order to continue till the next date of listing
  • Next hearing scheduled for March 25, 2026

item.title: [TATACOMM] Tata Communications Ltd Grants 24,654 Employee Stock Options Under 'Tata Communications Limited - Stock Unit Plan 2023'
item.description:
Tata Communications Ltd has granted 24,654 employee stock options under 'Tata Communications Limited - Stock Unit Plan 2023'. The grant was approved by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee (NRC) on February 26, 2026, with an effective date of March 1, 2026. The RSUs are exercisable into not more than 7,812 equity shares of face value of INR 10 each fully paid up. The RSUs shall vest with the employee on the satisfaction of a time-based and a performance-based vesting criteria, within a period of 1 to 3 years from the grant date.

  • Tata Communications Ltd grants 24,654 employee stock options under 'Tata Communications Limited - Stock Unit Plan 2023'

item.title: [DABUR] Dabur India Ltd: SEBI Regulation 30 Update; Orders for Tax Demand of Rs. 3,12,74,277 Set Aside
item.description:
Dabur India Ltd has submitted an update under Regulation 30 of the SEBI Listing Regulations regarding disclosures dated February 4, 2025 and October 3, 2025. The update pertains to orders passed by the Joint Commissioner, State Tax, Circle-C, Alwar, Rajasthan for a total demand of Rs. 3,12,74,277 (including interest and penalty) due to a product classification issue for financial years 2017-18, 2018-19, and 2019-20. The tax demand amounted to Rs. 97,28,014, the interest to Rs. 1,18,18,249, and the penalty to Rs. 97,28,014. The Company had filed appeals before the 1st Appellate Authority State Tax, Alwar, Rajasthan for each of the financial years. The Ld. Appellate Authority has set aside the aforementioned demand, including interest and penalty. The order was received on February 26, 2026, and there is no impact on the Company's operations or other activities.

  • Dabur India Ltd submits update under SEBI Regulation 30
  • Orders passed by Joint Commissioner, State Tax, Alwar, Rajasthan for a total demand of Rs. 3,12,74,277
  • Demand pertains to product classification issue for financial years 2017-18, 2018-19, and 2019-20
  • Company filed appeals before the 1st Appellate Authority State Tax, Alwar, Rajasthan
  • Appellate Authority set aside the demand, including interest and penalty

item.title: [COSMOFIRST] Cosmo First Ltd Announces Resignation of Business Head-Speciality Chemicals, Mr. Raj Sharma
item.description:
